results.title: Landscape in the mist = Topio stin omichli [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Theo Angelopoulos, Stephane Sorlat, Eric Heumann, Paradise Television, French Film Centre, ETI and Basic Cinematografica
results.brief_description: Theo Angelopoulos is internationally recognised as Greece’s leading filmmaker. Refusing to engage with cinema as a popular art, he instead has created an oeuvre of work committed to exploring the mytho-poetic possibilities of motion pictures. His work, too, can be understood increasingly as an exploration of, at first, Greece’s, and more recently, Europe’s, political and cultural legacy and contradictions. “Landscape in the mist” is on the face of it a simple story. Two children, Voula and Alexander, have been told by their mother that their father now resides in Germany. She does not want to admit to her children that they are illegitimate. The children, desiring their father who they have only ever dreamt about, decide to run away and find him in Germany. The road movie that unfolds becomes a series of symbolic tableaux through which Angelopoulos examines a contemporary Europe of ruthless economic and social borders, a Europe in which the divisions of East and West, rich and poor, affect every encounter the children have. In their fate, we can read a long history of post-World War II immigration that is not only about the loss of notions of home, but also about the loss of traditional ties of family, ritual and space. In a sense, “Landscape in the mist” is a requiem to the loss of innocence - not only that of the children, but also for Europe itself. Music by Eleni Karaindrou. In Greek with English subtitles.

results.title: Landscape in stamps
results.creator_credit: Michael Reeves, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Poetry, music and the detail of postage stamps are combined to produce an essentially impressionistic view of New Zealand’s social and physical landscape. A new direction of stamp concept.

results.title: Landscape in painting
results.brief_description: Surveys the history of landscape painting from the Roman period to the present day. Shows how the painting of landscapes in different historical periods differed in style, execution and intention.

results.title: Landscape after battle
results.creator_credit: Andrzej Wajda and Polish Corporation for Film Production
results.brief_description: World War 2 has ended, but former prisoners of the Nazis are left with emotional scars. Life outside the camp is now unknown and unimaginable. A small group of survivors wait for their futures to be decided in an old army barracks. Two members of the group begin an affair, until the woman is accidentally killed by an American guard. Based on the stories of Tadeusz Borowski, an Auschwitz survivor. An examination of life after witnessing and living through the holocaust. Nominated for the Palme d’Or award at the Cannes Film Festival in 1970. In Polish with English subtitles.

results.title: Landfill
results.brief_description: This film tells of an operation in the United States to dispose of solid waste with a minimum of danger to the environment and people. Refuse is transported to a site away from the cities where several large steep gullies have been excavated for the purpose of holding the waste material. When filled with refuse, the gullies are covered avoiding infestation by flies, rats and seagulls.

results.title: Landfall Asia
results.creator_credit: Gordon Sparling, William Canning, Tim Wilson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A spring cruise to the Far East with three destroyers of the Royal Canadian Navy. The film follows the ships to the exotic ports of Japan, Hong Kong, Ceylon, Bangkok. Highlighted is the Commonwealth exercise, “Jetex,” a simulated naval engagement.

results.title: Land without music
results.creator_credit: Walter Forde, Max Schach, Capitol Film Corporation and J H Productions
results.brief_description: A light-hearted operetta composed by Oscar Straus and adapted for the screen by Rudolf Bernauer based on a supposedly true story that took place in the early part of the 19th century. It is a tale of forbidden music where no instruments or singing is allowed in order that the townsfolk can concentrate on more serious things such as making money to pay off the town’s debts. Stars Richard Tauber as Mario Carlini and features Jimmy Durante (Schnozzle) as Jonah J. Whistler. Cast also includes Diana Napier (Princess Regent), June Clyde (Sadie Whistler), Derrick de Marney (Rudolpho Strozzi, Esme Percy (Austrian Ambassador).
